thread.title: Utes take to Twitter over LDS institute issue
thread.title_full: Utes take to Twitter over LDS institute issue

title: Utes take to Twitter over LDS institute issue
text:
By Ryan McDonald , Deseret News Published: Wednesday, Oct. 21 2015 10:20 a.m. MDT Updated: 3 minutes ago Utah football players participate in post-practice institute teachings in Salt Lake City on Thursday, April 23, 2015. Chelsey Allder, Deseret News Summary 
Current and former University of Utah players express opinions on social media about a letter sent to the university urging it to stop coaches from teaching an LDS Church institute class. 
Not long after a letter was sent to the University of Utah on Tuesday asking it to stop Ute football coaches from teaching classes similar to those taught through The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints' Institute of Religion on campus, a bevy of current and former players let their opinions on the issue be known via Twitter. 
The consensus: They weren't fans of the request, which was made by Americans United for the Separation of Church and State, an organization based in Washington, D.C. 
A roundup of some of the tweets sent by the current and former players, most of them linked to a story written Tuesday by KSL's Josh Furlong: 
https://twitter.com/AndyDPhillips/status/656546509362626560
